alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued March 15 at 7:22AM PDT until March 15 at 10:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility as low as one quarter mile in freezing fog. * WHERE...The Rogue and Illinois Valleys in Josephine and Jackson Counties. This includes Medford, Cave Junction, Grants Pass, Gold Hill, Central Point and Selma. This also includes portions of Interstate 5 and Highway 199 as well as the passes north of Grants Pass and Hayes Hill Summit. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions from low visibility and slippery conditions due to frost on bridges and area roadways. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * If possible, wait for temperatures to warm above freezing before traveling. * Slow down and give 3 times as much space as normal between vehicles. * Use low beams. High beams reflect back fog making visibility worse for you and other drivers. * Fog makes objects appear farther away than they are. * Don`t use cruise control. Most crashes occur because the driver is going too fast for weather conditions.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County
